metadata.title: Overview

content:
1. Go through ‚Äúpriority column‚Äù together with the new data scientist. If there is a prospect of a new project, then play with the priorities accordingly. (NOTE: If a task is prioritized, the new comer should complete it within the first 2 weeks. All remaining tasks should be completed by the first 4 weeks of the recruitment. So, the orientation should be completed within the 4 weeks.)
2. In the new program, the first three steps must be completed within the first two weeks as a priority. Step 5 is optional, while Steps 4 and 6 should be completed under the Mentor‚Äôs guidance, with prioritization determined accordingly
3. Schedule meetings at the end of week 2 and week 4 to have checkpoints during the orientation process to see the progress and get the feedback.
4. When the new data scientist completes a task, he/she should put a check in ‚ÄúStatus‚Äù column to indicate that task is ‚Äúdone‚Äù.

metadata.title: Duplicate of Data Scientist Orientation Checklist- New

content:
tist completes a task, he/she should put a check in ‚ÄúStatus‚Äù column to indicate that task is ‚Äúdone‚Äù.
5. When the new data scientist completes a task, he / she should provide his / her feedback in ‚ÄúFeedback/ Comment‚Äù column, which could be used as a corrective input to improve the orientation process.
6. At the end of week 4, the new comer completes the whole orientation process by completing all the orientation tasks and providing final feedback to overall process.
7. This final status with overall feedback is sent later to the new DS‚Äôs manager and HR to further improve the orientation process.

> Info: Mentor‚Äôs guideline on how to utilize this checklist?
